channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Microsoft’s Recall Feature Is Even More Hackable Than You Thought
item.description: A new discovery that the AI-enabled feature’s historical data can be accessed even by hackers without administrator privileges only contributes to the...

item.title: Bangladeshi police agents accused of selling citizens’ personal information on Telegram
item.description: Two senior police officials in Bangladesh are accused of collecting and selling citizens' personal information to criminals on Telegram. © 2024 TechCr...

item.title: Oral-B Sold a $230 Alexa Toothbrush—and Then Pulled the Plug
item.description: A few years after touting the Oral-B Guide’s Alexa integration, the company has yanked the app you need to connect to it.

item.title: Carta’s valuation will be cut by billions in an upcoming secondary sale
item.description: Carta, a once-high-flying Silicon Valley startup that loudly backed away from one of its businesses earlier this year, is working on a secondary sale ...

item.title: US National Security Experts Warn AI Giants Aren't Doing Enough to Protect Their Secrets
item.description: Susan Rice, who helped the White House broker an AI safety agreement with OpenAI and other tech companies, says she's worried China will steal America...

item.title: Boeing’s Starliner overcomes leaks and engine trouble to dock with ‘the big city in the sky’
item.description: Boeing’s Starliner spacecraft has successfully delivered two astronauts to the International Space Station, a key milestone in the aerospace giant’s q...

item.title: The Case for MDMA’s Approval Is Riddled With Problems
item.description: The FDA is considering approving MDMA alongside psychotherapy as a treatment for PTSD. But evidence of the drug’s effectiveness isn’t clear cut.

item.title: Rivian’s path to survival is now remarkably clear
item.description: Rivian needs to sell its new revamped vehicles at a profit in order to sustain itself long enough to get to the cheaper mass market R2 SUV on the road...

item.title: Former Autonomy CEO Mike Lynch Cleared in US Fraud Trial
item.description: Mike Lynch, a software mogul once heralded as “Britain’s Bill Gates,” has been acquitted of fraud by a jury in the US.

item.title: What to expect from WWDC 2024: iOS 18, macOS 15 and so much AI
item.description: Apple is hoping to make WWDC 2024 memorable as it finally spells out its generative AI plans. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use...
